faqs.question: What procedures does Dr Mark Magdy specialize in?
faqs.answer: Dr Mark Magdy specializes in laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy, intragastric balloon, gastric bypass, mini-bypass, SADI, and hiatus hernia repair.

faqs.question: What are Dr Mark Magdy's qualifications?
faqs.answer: Dr Magdy holds an MBBS from University of New South Wales, is a Fellow of RACS, has an international North American fellowship, a D.E.S in robotic/laparoscopic bariatric surgery, and is an IFSO member.

faqs.question: Where does Dr Mark Magdy perform surgery?
faqs.answer: Dr Magdy performs surgery at St George Private Hospital and Kareena Private Hospital in Sydney, NSW.

credentials.medical_school: University of Leeds, United Kingdom (MB ChB, 2002)
fellowships: Australian and New Zealand Hepato-Pancreato-Biliary Association
professional_memberships: Australian and New Zealand Hepato-Pancreato-Biliary Association

procedures: Laparoscopic hiatus hernia and anti-reflux surgery

unique_features: Over 90% of procedures are minimally invasive (laparoscopic or robotic)
Special expertise in complex HPB (liver, pancreas, gallbladder) and upper GI cases
Mesh-free hernia repair option for suitable patients
Clinical lecturer at the University of New South Wales
Masters degree in Upper GI Surgery

faqs.question: What procedures does Dr Robert Gandy specialize in?
faqs.answer: Dr Gandy specializes in laparoscopic and robotic weight loss surgery (sleeve gastrectomy, gastric bypass), gallbladder removal, hernia repairs (including mesh-free), anti-reflux surgery, complex liver, pancreas, and stomach surgery, and endoscopy.

faqs.question: What are Dr Robert Gandy's qualifications?
faqs.answer: Dr Gandy holds an MB ChB from the University of Leeds, a Masters in Upper GI Surgery from the University of Sydney, and is a Fellow of the Royal Australasian College of Surgeons with post-fellowship training in Hepato-Pancreato-Biliary surgery.

faqs.question: Where does Dr Robert Gandy perform surgery?
faqs.answer: Dr Gandy operates at Prince of Wales Private and Public Hospitals in Randwick, East Sydney Private Hospital, and Chris O'Brien Lifehouse in Camperdown.

faqs.question: What procedures does Mr Niruben Rajasagaram specialize in?
faqs.answer: Mr Rajasagaram specializes in gastric sleeve, gastric bypass (including mini gastric bypass and revisional procedures), gastric band, gastric balloon, laparoscopic bariatric, gall bladder, and hernia surgeries.

faqs.question: What are Mr Niruben Rajasagaram's qualifications?
faqs.answer: He graduated from the Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland, holds the MRCS and FRACS, and has completed 4-year fellowships in bariatric, upper gastrointestinal, and advanced biliary surgery as well as specialized training with ANZGOSA.

faqs.question: Where does Mr Niruben Rajasagaram perform surgery?
faqs.answer: He operates primarily at Knox Private Hospital in Wantirna and Mulgrave Private Hospital in Melbourne, Victoria.

faqs.question: What procedures does Dr Yuan Cheng specialize in?
faqs.answer: Dr Yuan Cheng specializes in sleeve gastrectomy, Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, mini gastric bypass, adjustable gastric banding, intragastric balloon placement, and complex revision bariatric surgeries.

faqs.question: What are Dr Yuan Cheng's qualifications?
faqs.answer: Dr Yuan Cheng holds an MBBS from University of Melbourne, is a Fellow of the Royal Australasian College of Surgeons (FRACS) in General Surgery, completed an inaugural Bariatric Surgery Fellowship at Box Hill Hospital, and undertook advanced bariatric surgery training in Belgium under Dr. B. Dillemans.

faqs.question: Where does Dr Yuan Cheng perform surgery?
faqs.answer: Dr Cheng operates at Epworth Eastern Hospital, Epworth Freemasons Hospital, Knox Private Hospital, Holmesglen Private Hospital, St Vincent's Private Hospital, and Box Hill Hospital in Victoria, Australia.

faqs.question: What procedures does A/Prof Christos Apostolou specialize in?
faqs.answer: A/Prof Apostolou specializes in upper gastrointestinal, liver, biliary, pancreatic, and bariatric surgery (laparoscopic, robotic, and open), as well as endoscopy/ERCP, hernia, and gallbladder/anti-reflux surgery.

faqs.question: What are A/Prof Christos Apostolou's qualifications?
faqs.answer: He holds an MBChB and a Master of Medicine (Surgery) from the University of Cape Town, is a Fellow of both the South African College of Surgeons and the Royal Australasian College of Surgeons, and holds a Certificate of Surgical Gastroenterology.

faqs.question: Where does A/Prof Christos Apostolou perform surgery?
faqs.answer: He operates at Sydney Adventist Hospital (Wahroonga), Macquarie University Hospital, Northern Beaches Hospital, Bankstown-Lidcombe Hospital, and Norwest Private Hospital.
